item.title: Enterprise Cyber Range & CTF Platform
item.description:
Project Status: [Production / Maintenance]

Overview

To reduce reliance on external vendors (HackTheBox, TryHackMe) for internal team training, I architected a local Cyber Range. This platform allows for the deployment of vulnerable-by-design infrastructure that mimics our actual corporate environment.

Architecture

  • Hypervisor: Proxmox VE managing Windows Active Directory targets.
  • Containerization: Docker for ephemeral web challenges (OWASP juice shop, custom apps).
  • Network: Segregated VLANs to isolate vulnerable machines from the corporate network while allowing VPN access for the security team.

Key Features

  • Automated Deployment: Ansible scripts to spin up a fresh “Red Team Scenario” in under 10 minutes.
  • Scoreboard: Custom Python/Flask application to track team progress and flag captures.
  • Traffic Simulation: Noise generators to simulate user activity, making “stealth” a requirement for the attackers.

Documentation on specific challenge design is available internally.
